comments:
When I "Debug on Server" for test.jsp, which is in WEB-CONTENT of a J2EE module,
when I hit a JSP breakpoint, the editor comes up and say it can't find the
source path.
marking as "major P2" since will appear as loss of function in new flex projects
I believe 89346 is impacting this.  I'll see if I can come up with at patch.

Created an attachment (id=20494)
Patch to o.e.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal to fix source path calculation

In case this patch is considered for M4, this patch consists of new code to
help TomcatSourcePathComputerDelegate calculate the correct "work" paths.  
Existing code outside of TomcatSourcePathComputerDelegate remains unchanged.

SourcePathComputer.computeSourceContainers() ends up returning an empty array
because of an exception.  Larry's patch does fix this:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 2005-04-29 01:41:31.546
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug Core: 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The archive:
D:/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28/work/Catalina/localhost/module001 which is referenced
by the classpath, does not exist.

Bug 93174 mentions working around this problem by manually adding the project.

Assigning to Tim for review and inclusion. (The patches appear correct and safe
to me, but Tim should make final decision for M re-build.)
